meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a drone
meanings.sent1: The dronish sound of the bee was soothing.
meanings.sent2: The sky was filled with dronish drones during the parade.
meanings.sent3: The dronish hum of the air conditioner put me to sleep.
meanings.sent4: The dronish routine of daily life felt like a never-ending cycle.
meanings.sent5: The dronish landscape of the desert stretched endlessly before us.

meanings.definition: Tending to drone or speak in a monotonous tone
meanings.sent1: His dronish voice made it hard to stay awake in class.
meanings.sent2: The professor's dronish lecture bored the students.
meanings.sent3: The dronish tone of the radio announcer made the news sound dull.
meanings.sent4: Her dronish storytelling put the children to sleep in minutes.
meanings.sent5: The dronish speech of the politician failed to captivate the audience.

meanings.definition: Showing laziness or lack of energy
meanings.sent1: His dronish movements indicated he was tired.
meanings.sent2: The cat's dronish behavior suggested it needed a nap.
meanings.sent3: The dronish sloth lazed around in the tree all day.
meanings.sent4: The dronish slothfulness of the rainy day made me want to stay in bed.
meanings.sent5: The dronish attitude of the employees affected the productivity of the office.
